intro: Echium polybotryum, commonly known as the New Zealand flax or kōwhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces distinctive, elongated seed capsules. Echium polybotryum is adapted to grow in coastal and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its ecological importance includes providing nectar for native pollinators and supporting various invertebrate species.
